name: Creamy Penne Pasta
description: This pasta recipe is so easy and so good! Wonderful made with crab, shrimp or chicken. You can also use fat free cream cheese if you're watching calories.  Serve with grated Parmesan.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat olive oil.  Stir in garlic, basil, oregano, parsley, tomato, salt and pepper, and cook 5 minutes.  Stir in cream cheese until melted.  (Add meat, if desired, at this time.)  Heat through, toss with cooked pasta and serve.

review.reviewBody: I did not have high expectations for this dish...I was just looking for a fast and easy recipe. This was awesome!! However I made many alterations to the dish due to time contraints. First I heated the olive oil and browned some garlic and minced onion. I then added 1 cup chicken and half green and half red bell pepper chopped. When the cubed chicken was cooked through I added 1 8oz container of cream cheese with chives and 1 can Italian stewed tomatoes. This addition not only thinned the sauce as others have stated but also it allowed me to eliminate the basil parsley and other spices. Served over the penne pasta and viola!! Dinner was a hit (to my surprise). Sprinkled some dry parsley and parmesean cheese over all for presentation. Great recipe Toni (even altered) and will make again!!

This was a great start to a wonderful dinner. I changed a few things because it had quite a few bad reviews. I added 1 8oz package of mushrooms 1 red pepper sliced fresh green beans 1 cup of milk and 4 cloves of garlic. I also used low fat cream cheese and dried spices because I didnt have any on hand. My dinner was great! The recipe is to thick without the milk. My fiancee is picky and he really enjoyed it. Thanks for sharing the recipe!

Amazing! I am now inspired to grow my own herbs for cooking. The fresh basil oregano and parsley are neccessary for this recipe to work. I was a little scared after reading some of the reviews but it was great! The only thing I did different was used low fat cream cheese and substituted 2 Roma tomatoes. I served it with grilled chicken soaked in a red wine marinade. I am not a very good cook but this was delicious. My fiance loved it! What impresses me is being able to make a fantastic meal in under 5.00 Thanks Toni-great job

I liked this (as did my 5 year old)....I added a finely diced onion with the garlic and sauteed first then added the herbs and two diced fresh tomatoes. I also used low-fat cream cheese. I didn't think the sauce was too thick (it held the herbs and stuff nicely to the penne) -- until it cooled off....just add a splash of milk to thin.

I really loved this recipe. At first I wasn't too sure about tomatoes and cream cheese. But all the different ingredients really work. I did use canned Italian tomatoes and added onions with the garlic and used the chive and onion cream cheese in the tub. But those were the only changes I made. Oh I did add fake crab to the mixture and it was so good. I am glad that I overlooked my thinking and made this. I will definitely make it again.
This recipie was HORRIBLE... I had to add an extra POUND of butter and 2 cups of water just to try to get it to taste decent....

Very good and easy to make. It's important to use fresh herbs as they really enhance the flavor. (Plus they make the kitchen smell wonderful.) I added chicken marinated in lemon juice and garlic and the tang of the chicken was a delicious set off against the cream sauce.

I made this with seasonings that weren't fresh. I also used Italian style stewed tomatoes and half the amount of cream cheese. The results? While it didn't taste bad it was kind of tasteless (probably my fault for using dried seasonings). Even though I used the liquid from the tomatoes and half the cream cheese my roommate complained that it was too thick.

This was delicious and we'll definitely be making it again! We added mushrooms and onions to the mix and a spoon of pesto. A little seasoning also to give the sauce more of a flavor. 1/2 cream cheese and then used 4 oz of a delicious chive & onion sour cream. Oh and after the pasta was added to the sauce we threw in a handful of shredded mozzarella that melted in nicely. Yum!!
